page.title: 01TOURISM,SAUNDERSFOOT
page.content: This is a semi-rural tourist area, consisting of a seaside village with good sandy beaches, with a well maintained harbour for pleasure boats and fishing vessels, situated in the South West corner of Dyfed.The surrounding land is mainly managed grassland, some of which is taken over for tourism purposes,caravans and tents.The character of the block has changed dramatically in the last fifty years from an industrial coal mining village to its present tourism and agriculture base.It also provides dormitory facilities for workers in the adjacent industrial towns,Pembroke ,Milford Haven and Carmarthen.Tourist accommodation ranges from tents to the three_star hotel.Entertainment for the family holiday maker from the bucket and spade to the sophisticated nightclub.
